profile_data.summary:
“Data is like oil – it is of no value while unrefined, but of unlimited value once it is refined.”

6 years as a Data scientist in Financial Services Industry(Investments and Insurance) working on use cases from Traditional Machine learning to Time series forecasting and Deep Learning.
✔ Finalist at Walmart's Sponsored competition : Brick and Code 2.0 Challenge(Data Scientist).

✔ Internship Experience: I interned with a Quant fund startup where I built Quant models to forecast the Future Bitcoin Price exploiting Deep Learning and research on arXiv(https://arxiv.org/)

✔ Full-time Data Science Experience:
1)  I worked in John Hancock mostly on Machine learning use cases in Life Insurance and Investments leveraging NLP and Traditional Machine Learning Algorithms.

Tools/Programming Languages used: Python, SQL, Tableau, Hadoop, Keras, Spacy, TensorFlow

2) I am currently working in Progressive Insurance mostly working on use cases related to Pricing Data Science leveraging Time series forecasting and Deep learning to forecast Claims frequency and Severity. This role is a combination of Machine learning engineer and Data Scientist. We deploy these time series models for the Pricing Org to consume our forecasts to determine pricing of premiums.

Tools/Programming Languages used:  R, Python(Pandas, Orbit, Prophet, statsmodels), Bash, SQL, Jenkins, Docker, Git, AWS(S3, EC2) & Tableau, RNN and LSTM

Gained Expertise in Machine Learning/Deep Learning Concepts:
✔  Machine Learning/Deep Learning: Linear Regression, Generalized Linear Regression, Regularized Regression (Lasso, Ridge, ElasticNet), Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, KNN, Naive Bayes, Decision Trees, Random Forest, XGBoost, CatBoost, LightGBM,  Time Series Forecasting(ARIMA, Orbit(Bayesian Modeling), Prophet), K-Means Clustering, Hierarchical Clustering, Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Independent Component Analysis (ICA), Autoencoders, Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), t-SNE, Self-Organizing Maps (SOM), Sequence Models(RNN, LSTM), Convolutional Neural Networks, GRUs, Transformers, Generative Adversial Networks(GANs)
 
Certifications:
✔  Bloomberg Marketing Concepts, Statistical Learning: Stanford university, Stanford SQL Certification, Exam P,  Deeplearning.ai (Mathematics for Machine learning Specialization, Deep Learning Specialization, Machine Learning Specialization), SAS Statistical Business Analyst Professional Certificate

Contact Info: ✉ punyaswaroop12@gmail.com
GITHUB: https://github.com/Punya-Swaroop-Sirgiri/
Kaggle: https://www.kaggle.com/punyaswaroop12/competitions
profile_data.headline: Senior Data Scientist at Progressive | Kaggle Top 9%, 14% | Generative AI, Neural Networks, Quant Finance

experience.description:
1) Used Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) to implement Bitcoin closing price prediction to learn long-term dependencies and it was able to obtain highly expressive features and efficiently learn trends and interactions of multivariate time series leveraging the trading information of the bitcoin market along with the impact of external factors such as macroeconomic variables and investor attention on the Bitcoin price 
2) Evaluated the models(LSTM, MLP and CNN) using 3 error functions:  MAE, RMSE and MAPE and LSTM outperformed the other 2 models on all the 3 perfomance metrics.
experience.title: Quantitative Trader Intern

experience.description: Performed twitter sentiment analysis to measure customer satisfaction level of the Walmart’s savings catcher app. Due to unsatisfactory customer behavior, we (Cross-Functional team) developed a new Mobile app: Walmart Now which provides instantaneous benefits that help improve shopping experience of millennials.
experience.title: Finalist at Brick and Code Hackathon: Data Scientist
Indian Academy of Sciences: Summer Research Fellow | Data Analytics

projects.description: Automatic recognition of hand written digits involves the use of image processing, computer vision, and, or, artificial intelligence translation from a digit or string of digits written by hand, to a set of characters accurately represented in memory by a computer without explicit human guidance. Draw a digit using the computer mouse in a designated area and the app outputs the number label using deep CNN
projects.title: Hand Drawn Digit Recognition(Web App)
